instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message:
got an 820-3115 with green light and orange when bat is connected.  no fan and no power.  checked the fuse, checked the one wire circuit seemed like everything was good.  Were should i test?
Thanks Again

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message:
What voltage is PPBUS_G3H?
What voltage is PP3V3_S5?
What voltage is PP5V_S5?
What voltage is PP5V_S3?
Why is this dead? Drop, spill, or none of the above?

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H  -- 12.56v
 PP3V3_S5  --   3.32v
 PP5V_S5  --    5.1v
 PP5V_S3  --   0v  my issue is  apparently on  pp5v_s3 circuit 

Def. water damaged.

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: Voltages on C1802/03? Where was the liquid. clock chip?

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: liquid was about 2-3 Inch in size or more around the lvds.  i did ultra sonic it prior.

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: I asked more.....

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message:
oh shit!!! sorry i took the measurement but for got to post them!

c1802 @3.3v
03 @ 3.3v

Also were is the clock chip? / part number?

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: U2600. How is R7402/03 looking?

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message:
hmm. i guess this board was not ultra sonic cleaned yet.  it has soda pop on it pretty bad wrote down the primary affected areas for reference.  replaced some parts on the g3h, pp3v3 and ppbus, along with a few other parts.  there is way to much soda on/ under chips to expect it to power on at this point so when its done with its bath i will update.  sorry i didnt realize this before.  

The r7402 did not look affected but in the same area i found some nasty looking stuff.  (which led me to my realization here)

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: okay so now its powering on and working, the only thing is that its charging the computer but it wont run off of the battery.

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: Battery recognized in OSX with cycles and charge capacity?

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: Yes.  It give me the cycles, charge capacity,  how much it has to go etc.  and it says its charging. and i was just testing it took the power supply off, it stayed on for a few seconds but as soon as i move the computer screen a bit it turns off and wont power up on it. battery has 57% charge.

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message:
PPBUS voltage with just battery plugged in?
Try how long it stays on when you pull the AC

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message:
11.79v on the ppbus with only the battery connected.

I will test how long it will stay on right now an post back.

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message:
also it seems like it does not want to power on with the battery installed. but it will after a few tries. its possible maybe the charger adapter is messed up and isnt making the best connection though.  
it also seems like if i move the board it powers off so im wondering maybe a loose component also?   i have left the computer on running only on battery for  10 min + without it powering down and is not showing any signs that it is going to shut down. if i move the computer though it will turn off, it only takes a slight movement or bump and it shuts down.

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: Does the shutdown only happen on battery?

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: no it also does it with the power supply.  at first i thought the ps had moved or something causing it to turn off but it clearly is not the charger.

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: Bad RAM slots? Try one at a time.

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: nope,  the ram slots seem to be working fine.

threads.title: 820-3115 wont power on.
threads.message: Out of ideas on this one. Louis must know something maybe.
